item.title: MSR India Q3 FY26: Revenue-Less Operations Continue as Losses Mount
item.description: MSR India Ltd., a micro-cap infrastructure and construction company with a market capitalisation of ₹33.00 crores, reported another quarter of operational distress in Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), posting a net loss of ₹0.29 crores with zero revenue generation. The Hyderabad-based firm, which trades at ₹5.35 on the NSE, has now recorded seven consecutive quarters without any sales, marking a stark departure from its historical operations in civil works and land development activities. Time: Feb 16 2026 10:41 PM IST

item.title: V2 Retail Joins Reliable Performers List Following Robust Quarterly Growth
item.description: V2 Retail, a small-cap player in the garments and apparels sector, has been added to the esteemed Reliable Performers list as of 16 February 2026, following a robust quarterly financial performance that underscores its growing fundamental strength and promising outlook. Time: Feb 16 2026 10:30 PM IST

item.title: National Fertilizer Joins Hidden Turnarounds List on Strong Quarterly Performance
item.description: Natl.Fertilizer has been added to the Hidden Turnarounds list as of 16 February 2026, following a remarkable quarterly financial performance that signals a potential fundamental turnaround. The small-cap stock, trading at Rs 81.16 at the time of inclusion, has demonstrated robust growth metrics and improved profitability, positioning it as a compelling candidate for investors seeking early-stage recovery plays in the fertiliser sector. Time: Feb 16 2026 10:30 PM IST

item.title: Lexus Granito Q3 FY26: Severe Revenue Contraction Deepens Operational Crisis
item.description: Lexus Granito (India) Ltd., a micro-cap diversified consumer products company with a market capitalisation of ₹72.00 crores, reported deeply troubling Q3 FY26 results that underscore mounting operational distress. The company posted a net profit of ₹0.71 crores for the December 2025 quarter, up 91.89% quarter-on-quarter from ₹0.37 crores but down 787.50% year-on-year from ₹0.08 crores. However, this headline profit figure masks a catastrophic revenue collapse and severe margin deterioration that signal fundamental business challenges. Time: Feb 16 2026 10:21 PM IST

item.title: Parmax Pharma Q3 FY26: Mounting Losses Deepen as Revenue Plummets 72% YoY
item.description: Parmax Pharma Ltd., a micro-cap pharmaceutical company specialising in Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) and Contract Manufacturing Operations (CMO), has reported deeply concerning financial results for Q3 FY26, with net losses widening to ₹0.73 crores whilst revenues collapsed 72.74% year-on-year to ₹2.53 crores. The company, trading at ₹32.00 with a market capitalisation of just ₹12.00 crores, has now recorded consecutive quarterly losses throughout FY26, raising serious questions about operational viability and management execution. Time: Feb 16 2026 10:05 PM IST

item.title: Dalmia Industrial Development Q3 FY26: Losses Deepen Amid Revenue Volatility
item.description: Dalmia Industrial Development Ltd., a micro-cap trading and distribution company, reported a challenging third quarter for FY2026, posting a net loss of ₹0.11 crores in Q3 FY26 compared to a profit of ₹0.19 crores in the preceding quarter. The company's market capitalisation stands at ₹19.00 crores, with shares trading at ₹9.60 following a 4.46% gain on February 16, 2026, as investors reacted to the mixed quarterly performance. Time: Feb 16 2026 09:48 PM IST

item.title: Lorenzini Apparels Q3 FY26: Profitability Returns But Margin Pressure Persists
item.description: Lorenzini Apparels Ltd., a micro-cap garments and apparels manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹146.00 crores, reported a modest return to profitability in Q3 FY26 with net profit of ₹1.10 crores, declining 22.54% quarter-on-quarter but reversing from a loss of ₹1.62 crores in the year-ago period. However, the quarter's results reveal persistent margin pressures and operational challenges that continue to weigh on the company's financial performance. Time: Feb 16 2026 09:34 PM IST

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture across market capitalisations, sectors, and individual companies. With over 4,000 stocks reporting, the aggregate data reveals a modest improvement in positive results, led by mid-cap companies, while large caps continue to face challenges amid a cautious economic backdrop. Time: Feb 16 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Chandrima Mercantiles Q3 FY26: Profit Volatility Masks Underlying Concerns
item.description: Chandrima Mercantiles Ltd., a micro-cap agricultural products trading company with a market capitalisation of ₹224.00 crores, reported net profit of ₹0.41 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), representing a sharp 90.31% decline quarter-on-quarter from ₹4.23 crores in Q2 FY26. Year-on-year, profits rose 2.50% from ₹0.40 crores in Q3 FY25. The stock closed at ₹6.38 on February 16, 2026, down 0.78% on the day, trading 55.94% below its 52-week high of ₹14.48 but still up 173.82% from its 52-week low of ₹2.33. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:41 PM IST

item.title: La Opala RG Q3 FY26: Profit Resilience Amid Revenue Pressure
item.description: La Opala RG Ltd., the Kolkata-based premium glassware and lifestyle products manufacturer, reported a net profit of ₹24.00 crores for Q3 FY26, marking a marginal decline of 3.57% quarter-on-quarter but a modest improvement of 3.58% year-on-year. The company, with a market capitalisation of ₹2,153 crores, continues to navigate challenging demand conditions whilst maintaining profitability through disciplined cost management. However, the stock has faced significant selling pressure, declining 3.83% on February 16, 2026, to close at ₹190.85, reflecting investor concerns about sustained revenue headwinds and margin compression. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:38 PM IST

item.title: Heera Ispat Q3 FY26: Operational Dormancy Continues as Losses Persist
item.description: Heera Ispat Ltd., the Gujarat-based iron and steel products manufacturer, reported another quarter of operational inactivity in Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), with zero revenue generation and continued losses. The company posted a net loss of ₹0.01 crores for the quarter, marking no improvement from the previous quarter's loss of ₹0.05 crores. With a minuscule market capitalisation of just ₹4.00 crores and a negative book value per share of ₹0.95, the company remains in a state of effective dormancy, having generated no sales revenue for several consecutive quarters. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:35 PM IST

item.title: GP Petroleums Q3 FY26: Volume Growth Masks Margin Erosion Concerns
item.description: GP Petroleums Ltd., a Mumbai-based lubricants manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹175.00 crores, reported mixed results for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), with net profit declining 4.21% quarter-on-quarter to ₹5.24 crores despite robust revenue expansion. The stock plunged 6.51% to ₹32.59 following the announcement, reflecting investor disappointment over margin compression that overshadowed the company's 11.22% sequential sales growth to ₹169.23 crores. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:33 PM IST

item.title: True Green Bio Energy Q3 FY26: Explosive Revenue Surge Masks Fundamental Concerns
item.description: True Green Bio Energy Ltd., a micro-cap player in the garments and apparels sector, reported a dramatic revenue surge in Q3 FY26, with net sales skyrocketing to ₹84.20 crores—a staggering 3,727.27% quarter-on-quarter increase and 4,476.09% year-on-year growth. However, the company's net profit of ₹2.19 crores, whilst representing the highest quarterly profit in recent history, reflects a PAT margin of just 2.60%, raising questions about the sustainability and quality of this explosive growth. Trading at ₹71.15 with a market capitalisation of ₹243.00 crores, the stock has declined 32.27% over the past year, significantly underperforming the sector's 1.26% gain. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:32 PM IST

item.title: Rajasthan Tube Manufacturing Q3 FY26: Sharp Profit Rebound Masks Severe Revenue Collapse
item.description: Rajasthan Tube Manufacturing Company Ltd., a micro-cap steel pipes and tubes manufacturer, reported a dramatic turnaround in Q3 FY26 profitability whilst simultaneously experiencing a catastrophic revenue collapse that raises fundamental questions about business sustainability. The company posted net profit of ₹2.89 crores in Q3 FY26, a remarkable recovery from a loss of ₹0.28 crores in Q3 FY25, yet this improvement came against the backdrop of net sales plummeting 80.07% year-on-year to just ₹3.51 crores from ₹17.61 crores in the corresponding quarter last year. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:13 PM IST

item.title: Kay Power & Paper Q3 FY26: Mounting Losses Signal Deepening Operational Crisis
item.description: Kay Power & Paper Ltd., a Maharashtra-based MG Kraft paper manufacturer, reported a net loss of ₹0.09 crores in Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), marking a sharp deterioration from the marginal profit of ₹0.02 crores in Q2 FY26. The 550% quarter-on-quarter decline represents the company's worst quarterly performance in recent periods, as revenues collapsed 37.75% sequentially to just ₹4.75 crores. The micro-cap company, valued at ₹33 crores, saw its shares plunge 10.17% on February 16, 2026, closing at ₹8.48—a staggering 72.47% below its 52-week high of ₹30.80. Time: Feb 16 2026 08:02 PM IST

item.title: Sigma Advanced System Q3 FY26: Revenue Surge Masks Profitability Concerns
item.description: Sigma Advanced System Ltd., the Chennai-based telecom services company, reported a dramatic revenue revival in Q3 FY26, posting net sales of ₹145.70 crores—a staggering 702.75% quarter-on-quarter surge and 667.25% year-on-year growth. However, the company's consolidated net profit turned negative at ₹-1.03 crores, falling 124.35% from the previous quarter's ₹4.23 crores, raising serious questions about the sustainability and profitability of this revenue expansion. The stock closed at ₹176.20 on February 16, 2026, down 4.94% from the previous day, reflecting investor concerns about the company's ability to translate top-line growth into bottom-line performance. Time: Feb 16 2026 07:31 PM IST

item.title: Are Healthy Life Agritec Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Healthy Life Agritec Ltd's latest results show a recovery with a 7.67% increase in net sales and a 68.35% rise in net profit compared to the previous quarter. However, ongoing challenges, including a significant stock price decline and low return on equity, raise concerns about long-term investor confidence. Time: Feb 16 2026 07:12 PM IST

item.title: Are Athena Global Technologies Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Athena Global Technologies Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results are concerning, showing a net profit of ₹1.14 crores primarily due to a one-off income, while revenue declined by 47.26% year-on-year, indicating ongoing operational challenges and an unsustainable business model. The company faces significant financial strain with high employee costs and a deteriorating operating margin. Time: Feb 16 2026 07:12 PM IST

item.title: Are Uma Exports Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Uma Exports Ltd's latest results show strong sequential revenue growth of 38.31% to ₹560.44 crore, but a significant year-on-year net profit decline of 41.47% to ₹1.27 crore, indicating operational challenges and rising costs that may concern investors. Time: Feb 16 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Are Vishvprabha Ventures Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Vishvprabha Ventures Ltd's Q3 FY26 results are concerning, showing a net loss of ₹0.75 crore and an 80% revenue decline to ₹0.98 crore, alongside negative operating margins and deteriorating return on equity, indicating significant operational challenges and questions about its long-term viability. Time: Feb 16 2026 07:11 PM IST
